Package org.mitre.synthea.editors

Class GrowthDataErrorsEditor

java.lang.Object
org.mitre.synthea.editors.GrowthDataErrorsEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
HealthRecordEditor
public class GrowthDataErrorsEditor
extends java.lang.Object
implements HealthRecordEditor
This editor simulates errors that occur in growth data as it would be collected in a clinical setting. This editor is an implementation of the protocol for simulating growth data errors as specified in Supplemental File 5 in the paper "Automated identification of implausible values in growth data from pediatric electronic health records": https://academic.oup.com/jamia/article/24/6/1080/3767271

If a height or weight is changed, if the Encounter has an associated BMI, it will be recomputed based on the new, error values.

This module will only operate on Observations that take place while the patient is less than MAX_AGE.

    • shouldRun

      public boolean shouldRun​(Person person, HealthRecord record, long time)
      Checks to see if the person is under MAX_AGE.
      Specified by:
      shouldRun in interface HealthRecordEditor
      Parameters:
      person - The Synthea person to check on whether the module should be run
      record - The person's HealthRecord
      time - The current time in the simulation
      Returns:
      True if the person is under MAX_AGE

    • introduceWeightUnitError

      public static void introduceWeightUnitError​(HealthRecord.Encounter encounter)

      Parameters:
      encounter - The encounter that contains the observation

    • introduceHeightUnitError

    • introduceTransposeError

      public static void introduceTransposeError​(HealthRecord.Encounter encounter, java.lang.String obsType)
      Flip the tens and ones place in the desired observation value.
      Parameters:
      encounter - The encounter that contains the observation
      obsType - "height" or "weight"

    • introduceWeightSwitchError

      public static void introduceWeightSwitchError​(HealthRecord.Encounter encounter)
      Swap weight and height. This will work even if height is null. It will set weight to null and height to the weight value.
      Parameters:
      encounter - The encounter that contains the observation

    • introduceHeightSwitchError

      public static void introduceHeightSwitchError​(HealthRecord.Encounter encounter)
      Swap height and weight. This will work even if weight is null. It will set height to null and weight to height.
      Parameters:
      encounter - The encounter that contains the observation

      encounter - The encounter that contains the observation

    • introduceHeightAbsoluteError

      public static void introduceHeightAbsoluteError​(HealthRecord.Encounter encounter, RandomNumberGenerator random)
      Reduce the height observation by 3 to 6 cm. It looks like someone forgot to take off their shoes before getting measured.
      Parameters:
      encounter - The encounter that contains the observation

    • recalculateBMI

      public static void recalculateBMI​(HealthRecord.Encounter encounter)
      Recalculate the BMI based on the existing height and weigh observations in the encounter. Only recreates a BMI if one already exists. Otherwise, it does nothing.
      Parameters:
      encounter - to recalculate BMI on

    • encountersWithObservationsOfCode

      public java.util.List<HealthRecord.Encounter> encountersWithObservationsOfCode​(java.util.List<HealthRecord.Encounter> encounters, java.lang.String code)
      Filter a list of encounters to find all that have an observation with a particular code.
      Parameters:
      encounters - The list to filter
      code - The code to look for
      Returns:
      The filtered list. If there are no matching encounters, then an empty list.
